dataList.name: Yield My Flesh
dataList.desc:
Long eaves of the tile-roofing cast an impenetrable umbra. Beneath it stands a figure, submerged in the shadow, leaning against the wall.

They regard us in momentary silence before muttering in a low voice a question.

"Are you... prepared to yield your flesh, if it meant cleaving into your enemy's bones?"
"Take this blade, if you carry such determination."

Even at a glance, there's something about the sword in the figure's outstretched hand that gives off a disturbing air.

options.messageDesc: Select to gain a Cursed E.G.O Gift
result:
"Yield the flesh to claim their bones. Be ready to sacrifice the plum tree to save the peach tree." (肉斬骨斷, 李代桃僵)
"The resolve to be hewn permits one to cleave an even deeper wound."

The weight of "resolve to be hewn" pressed upon us the moment we took the sword.

"Those who refuse to cut have no use for blades and resolve alike."

With that, the figure returned the blade to his waist and left without a word.

dataList.name: T Corp. Time Prepayment Apparatus
dataList.desc: Behind an old billboard that's seen better days stands a vending machine emblazoned with a half-faded T Corp. logo. The machine is tall, with dozens of thin clock hands ticking and turning down its cylindrical body; there's a promotional tagline written beneath it. "Stop borrowing time!" "Pre-pay with your disposable time, and buy time without delay when in a pinch!" There's a small slot next to the machine for users to insert their hands. Wait, underneath the slot—there are warnings written in nigh-illegibly small font. "Upon use of this device, with the proviso that the user makes a payment of a sum of temporal resource, the user will be imposed a temporary time shortage open parenthesis for the purposes of this agreement, the "temporary time shortage" mentioned will be predicated on the T Corp. Variable Time Scale; however, any sum of a day or greater will be measured based on the A Corp. Standard Time Scale close parenthesis; received time prepayment will automatically be deposited and amassed within the ancillary accumulation device within the machine and will be prepared for provision to the user upon circumstances in which they make a withdrawal request via undertaking a series of procedures or the fulfillment of refund conditions stipulated in the manual thereof, by summation of the user's total per-day hours and the extrapolated acceleration rate subsidies calculated by a distinct formula; the precise period, order, and limitations in reflecting these changes to the user's account balance is determined by the device's terms of service as described—" "V-very well. The full extent of this multiloquous writing needn't be recited in full." "Hang on, ain't this one of them things the Collectors wear on their arms?"

options.messageDesc: Select to gain a Cursed E.G.O Gift
result:
Well, might as well make a deposit while we've got time to burn.

"It appears that this device functions on a mechanism not dissimilar from those installed in T Corp. Collection Staff's gauntlets, Executive Manager."

"Are you sure the payment went through? I don't feel any different."

<…….>

With the Sinners' slowed speech trailing behind, I hurried onward.

We're not exactly flush with time right now.

We decided to leave the device without using it.

dataList.name: Audio Logs of That Day
dataList.desc: We see an old voice recorder with a faded label. The "Play" button is smooth and worn from use—as though someone pressed it hundreds of times.

options.messageDesc: Select to gain a Cursed E.G.O Gift
result:
"Researcher ■■■■■■■■■. Are we ready to begin the interview?"

"A thoroughly pointless query to set forth when we both know that you are given every authority to choose when to start."

"Haha... Right then. Let's dive straight in."

"Regarding the ■■■■■ ■■■■■■, ■■■■ ■■■■ incident at ■■■... what was the situation like when it happened?"

"The entire facility began to quake and buckle. Then came the broadcast: Initiating site burial in 100 seconds."

"100 seconds... yes, that does sound rather brief, but given the technology implemented at ■ Corp. and the availability of transport units, that should've been enough time to evacuate."

"As you may know, the ■■■ Branch was one of the larger facilities, housing numerous Abnormalities of higher Risk Levels. Take ■■■ ■■■ or ■■, for instance."

"And naturally, some of those entities had the ability to seize control of the facility."

"Most exits were dead, including the elevators. We only had a single escape pod arriving."

"I was deemed the individual of the highest human resource value among those present—the only personnel for whom any available means of escape should be reserved."

"The others agreed, quite rationally, that I should be the one to evacuate."

"That is all."

"... You sound remarkably calm. As if you're relating an event that didn't even happen to you."

"Unnecessary addenda won't change the core issue of the subject under discussion, wouldn't you agree?"

"Nothing could be more inefficient than adding pointless sentiment to words."

"Don't you feel sorry for them? Not even a trace of remorse?"

"None."

"The prerequisite of apologetic sentiment is the existence of those who should receive it."

"That condition does not apply to me. Ergo, I have no need to indulge in such sentimentalities."

In the audio log, the researcher continued to answer the questions with a flat detachment.

The recording cut out into harsh, jarring static, leaving a hollow silence in its wake.

Sometimes, the best option is to back off.

We decided to move on without playing the recording.

dataList.name: Recurring Faith and Promise
dataList.desc:
We come across two bizarre lifeforms standing on either side of a table set with an old roulette wheel.

"Care you test your luck? A prize awaits those who have fortune's favor."
"Lose. No prize. Leave if don't want."

The old roulette wheel they point at is inscribed with strange symbols.

We cannot make sense of the symbols, but something about them keeps drawing our gaze.

What should we do?

options.messageDesc: Choose to gain or lose Cost
result:
We cannot take our eyes off the spinning roulette wheel.

The roulette comes to a stop, just short of slipping past the yellow slot.

"Oh, that's a win!"
"You. Lucky."

We cannot take our eyes off the spinning roulette wheel.

The roulette comes to a stop, just short of slipping past the blue slot.

"You. Bust. Scram."
"Too bad, that's a bust. And that means no prize money for you."

We were thrown out of the chamber, empty-handed.

"Wise. Choice."
"So you prove yourself a coward."

We escape the chamber.

dataList.name: Recurring Faith and Promise 2
dataList.desc:
"Another spin, perhaps? Double the prize this time."
"Leave. If. Don't. Want."

options.messageDesc: Choose to gain or lose Cost
result:
We cannot take our eyes off the spinning roulette wheel.

The roulette comes to a stop, just short of slipping past the yellow slot.

"Oh, that's a win!"
"You. Lucky."

We cannot take our eyes off the spinning roulette wheel.

The roulette comes to a stop, just short of slipping past the blue slot.

"You. Bust. Scram."
"Too bad, that's a bust. And that means no prize money for you."

We were thrown out of the chamber, empty-handed.

"The wise knows when to call it quits."
"The wise. Don't. Gamble."

I no longer feel the magnetic pull the roulette wheel once had on my gaze.

We leave the room with a sack of cash in hand.

options.messageDesc: Select to gain an E.G.O Gift
result:
"No. Such. Rules."
"That would indeed make for a rather interesting choice."

The bizarre creatures trilled their puzzle pieces for a moment, then disappeared into the roulette wheel.

We picked up the roulette and continued on our way.

dataList.name: Recurring Faith and Promise 3
dataList.desc:
"How about one last game?"
"Remember. Always. In moderation."

options.messageDesc: Choose to gain or lose Cost
result:
We cannot take our eyes off the spinning roulette wheel.

The roulette comes to a stop, just short of slipping past the yellow slot.

"That's a clean win right there!"
"Your last. Crumb of. Luck. Don't. Ever. Come back."

The moment we take the hefty sack of cash, the roulette wheel and the bizarre creatures disappear.

We cannot take our eyes off the spinning roulette wheel.

The roulette comes to a stop, just short of slipping past the blue slot.

"Too bad, that's a bust. And that means no prize money for you."
"Had a. Feeling. Don't. Ever. Come back."

We were booted out of there, empty-handed.

"The wise knows when to call it quits."
"The wise. Don't. Gamble."

I no longer feel the magnetic pull the roulette wheel once had on my gaze.

We leave the room with a sack of cash in hand.
